text:
dicentric chromosome 15 syndrome
What are the genetic changes related to isodicentric chromosome 15 syndrome ?,"Isodicentric chromosome 15 syndrome results from the presence of an abnormal extra chromosome, called an isodicentric chromosome 15, in each cell. An isodicentric chromosome contains mirror-image segments of genetic material and has two constriction points (centromeres), rather than one centromere as in normal chromosomes.
